Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Plantaricin JY22 (BWQ, natural AMPs; bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: Lactobacillus plantarumJY22 from golden carp intestine fish:microbiota

Literature Information.Literature: Warning: only the N-terminal sequence was provided. APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (40%) toXLAsp-P2Discovery:screened 137 LAB strains isolated from freshwater fish intestine. Plantarum JY22 was purified from Cell free supernatant (CFS) by ethyl acetate and gel filtration.Activity: active against Gram+ B. cereus.Antimicrobial robustness: activity is heat-stable (autocalve); pH-sensitive: activity gradually decreased till pH 5.5 (74.2%) and lost at pH 6.5 or higher. Protease-susceptible (nutrase, pepsin, papain) but not alpha-amylaseMOA:bacteria: memrbane damage led to leakage.The original Phylloseptin-H10 has been merged with AP1350.
Literature Information.Author: Lv X, Miao L, Ma H, Bai F, Lin Y, Sun M, Li J. 2017
Literature Information.Title: Purification, characterization and action mechanism of plantaricin JY22, a novel bacteriocin against Bacillus cereus produced by Lactobacillus plantarum JY22 from golden carp intestine.
